error.signature: error[E0502]: cannot borrow `x` as mutable because it is also borrowed as immutable
error.regex: E0502.*cannot borrow.*as mutable because it is also borrowed as immutable

verdict.summary: Rust borrow checker prevents mutable borrow while an immutable borrow is still active.

dead_ends.action: Using unsafe to bypass the borrow checker
dead_ends.why_fails: Introduces undefined behavior; defeats Rust's safety guarantees
Wastes memory and CPU; hides the architectural issue

workarounds.action: Restructure code so immutable borrow ends before mutable borrow begins
workarounds.how: Use scoping blocks { let r = &x; ... } then let m = &mut x;

workarounds.action: Use RefCell<T> for interior mutability when compile-time borrow checking is too restrictive
workarounds.how: use std::cell::RefCell; let data = RefCell::new(vec![1,2,3]); let r = data.borrow(); let m = data.borrow_mut();
